This Nashville gem has earned a permanent spot on my Southern itinerary. If you're a breakfast aficionado like me, do yourself a favor and add it to your must-try list. Trust me, you won't regret it!

I'm still in shock about our recent experience with a detailing service! My husband and I were really looking forward to getting our car detailed, so he booked an appointment with Michael for the following Saturday. To confirm, he even called again on Friday to make sure everything was set. But when we arrived at the workshop the next day, we were surprised to find out that Michael didn't have us down for a full detailing service, even though we had specifically discussed it. He suggested we come back the following Saturday instead, so we agreed.

We arrived bright and early at 8am the next week, but to our surprise, the workshop was closed! We tried calling Michael, but he said he was busy and would call us back. We waited for half an hour, but there was no call. We decided to grab some breakfast and came back at 9:30am, hoping to give him another chance. That's when Alex, his partner, finally opened the shop. Unfortunately, Michael was still nowhere to be found, and Alex couldn't reach him either. We were really disappointed and decided to cancel our appointment. It was a frustrating experience, but we're hoping to find a better service elsewhere.

I recently had a complex relocation experience that necessitated additional support from this office. I was impressed by the exceptional service provided by the team, who demonstrated a high level of professionalism and integrity. They went to great lengths to ensure my needs were met, and I am grateful for their dedication. I would highly recommend this office to anyone, including family and friends, and have the utmost confidence in their ability to deliver outstanding results.

During our girls' getaway to New Orleans last year, we had the pleasure of staying at The Saint, a hotel that initially impressed us with its stunning lobby, trendy bar, and restaurant that exuded a sophisticated ambiance. The warm and inviting atmosphere, coupled with the friendly staff, set the tone for what promised to be an unforgettable weekend. I arrived a few hours prior to my friend's arrival, as I had a substantial amount of work to attend to. I settled into my room, ordered room service, and spent the next four hours productively working on my laptop. After completing my tasks, I took a break to purchase a bottle of wine and treat myself to a manicure and pedicure. Upon my friend's arrival, we were ready to take on the city, and our evening began with a delightful dinner outing. However, our merriment was short-lived, as we soon discovered a massive flying cockroach in our room. I was horrified and promptly marched down to the front desk to report the issue. The staff assured me that they would send a maintenance worker to address the problem, but I was adamant that this was not a sufficient solution, as I suspected that there might be other unwanted critters lurking in the shadows. To my dismay, the new room they provided was also infested with small spiders and dead insects in the window corners, and to make matters worse, the TV was malfunctioning, and one of the lamps was without bulbs. It was now around 3 am, and I had reached my breaking point. I promptly booked a room at my trusted go-to hotel, The W, for the remainder of our trip. The next morning, I demanded to speak with a manager, and a young gentleman apologized for the inconvenience. I thanked him for his apology and requested a full refund, which he graciously provided. He also extended an invitation for us to return to The Saint once they had implemented changes, but I politely declined, still shaken by our unpleasant experience.

Need a new door but only have $35 to spare? Look no further than the Green Project! This treasure trove of reclaimed materials has got you covered. And what about all those leftover building supplies, random lumber, roofing materials, and paint taking up space in your garage or basement? Instead of sending them to the landfill, bring them to the Green Project, where they can be repurposed and given new life. By choosing the Green Project, you'll not only reduce waste but also support a more sustainable future.

I was really disappointed with my experience at this spot. The bouncer could've been more welcoming, and it felt like they were taking advantage of their Broadway location to overcharge and treat customers poorly. As a local, I was expecting more. Unfortunately, I won't be back and wouldn't recommend it to others.

Wow, what a lunchtime treat! My girlfriend and I dropped by for a bite, and we were blown away by the sparkling cleanliness of the place. But the real star of the show was the food - absolutely phenomenal! And the best part? It won't break the bank! We can't wait to go back and indulge in another delicious meal!

I've been a loyal customer for years, but my recent visit was a letdown. The food quality has taken a noticeable dip. We started with an artichoke that seemed to have been prepared ahead of time, which resulted in a cold center despite being cooked through. The Greek salad my wife ordered was also a miss, with pre-packaged ingredients and an overabundance of flavorless dressing. Unfortunately, my grilled yellowtail was the biggest disappointment - it was overcooked and tasted like low-quality frozen fish, which is unacceptable for a restaurant of this caliber. While the setting and service were still pleasant, the subpar food overshadowed the positives. I hope the kitchen can revamp their dishes to restore this establishment to its former glory. With a little improvement, it could regain its status as a local gem.

Ready to shake up your brunch game? Look no further than Milktooth! This Indy hotspot serves up creative breakfast cocktails and twists on classic brunch dishes that will make your taste buds do the happy dance. Don't be intimidated if you don't recognize some of the menu items - trust us, you'll love whatever you order!

Be prepared for a short wait (about 30 minutes on weekends), but don't worry, you can grab a coffee or pastry at their walk-up bar to hold you over. It's the perfect sneak peek at the deliciousness to come!

Milktooth's menu is always evolving, but some fan favorites stay put, with seasonal ingredient swaps to keep things fresh. Their Dutch pancake variations are a must-try, and the raclette grilled cheese is absolute perfection. If you're feeling extra festive, don't miss the michelada - and if the weather's nice, snag a seat outside to soak up the sunshine!

We recently stayed at this hotel and had a fantastic experience, thanks to the amazing bar and staff! As a special touch, we were upgraded to a room with a stunning view since we were celebrating our honeymoon. However, despite the lovely view, the room itself was nothing out of the ordinary - comparable to a Hilton. We did notice some rust on the tub floor and strange stains on the tile, but these issues were limited to the bathroom.

Despite these minor flaws, I'd still give the hotel 4 stars due to the exceptional staff. One thing to note is that the valet parking was a bit pricey, so we opted to park a couple of streets down instead. If you're looking to stay in the heart of downtown St. Louis, surrounded by cool bars and restaurants, I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Friday nights are especially lively in the area!

Discovering a Hidden Gem: My Uplifting Experience at the Studio!

I stepped into the beginner's class at this studio, and it was love at first move! The pace was spot on, challenging me just enough to uncover hidden flexibility in unexpected places. I was thrilled to find myself breaking a sweat, and the rush of endorphins left me feeling amazing afterwards. The cherry on top? The studio's sparkling cleanliness and the convenient option to grab some healthy Beyond Organic goodies on my way out.

We finally found this great place! We were going to go to a chain lobster restaurant, but we wanted something more real and local. A friend told us about Lobster Haven, so I checked it online. It looked like the kind of place we like to eat at when we visit our family in Massachusetts. We loved it! The service was great, fast, and super friendly. They had a huge selection of all our favorite seafood dishes. If you want real New England seafood, you have to try this place! Plus, you can even buy live lobsters and fresh seafood to take home and cook yourself.

I'm thoroughly impressed with this establishment! They offer an exceptional happy hour experience, a constantly updated menu featuring fresh and exciting options, and their craft drinks are truly delicious. If I had the opportunity, I would make it a point to visit this place daily, it's that good!

I'm obsessed with Men's Clubs - it's the ultimate game-changer! Every single barber is a master of their craft, guaranteed to leave you looking and feeling like a million bucks. I've been a loyal customer for three years now, and I've never had a single complaint. Okay, okay, there was that one time when some shady character tried to rip off my signature style. But Tim, the hero of the hour, shut it down with a refreshing dose of honesty: "Sorry, buddy, I can't replicate Ryan's magic." Thanks, Tim, for keeping it real and keeping my hair on point!

My husband and I are regulars here, and for good reason. The food is consistently fresh and expertly prepared, and the service is always top-notch. If you're a sushi and hibachi lover like us, we can't recommend this place enough - it's a must-try!

Chickie's and Pete's is the ultimate spot to catch a game and indulge in delicious food and drinks. While the cuisine may not be the best I've ever had, the overall experience is unbeatable. If you can snag a seat, be sure to order the mussels red, crab fries, and a cold beer - it's a winning combination. My personal favorites include the crab fries, mussels red (the white variety can be overpowering with garlic), spicy pull and peel shrimp, steamers, and blue crabs (if you're up for the challenge). I appreciate how the restaurant makes it easy to get messy and enjoy your food without worrying about the aftermath, thanks to the conveniently located sinks.

In short, Chickie's and Pete's is a beloved Philadelphia institution that guarantees a good time. I highly recommend visiting at least once to experience it for yourself. Just keep in mind two important things before heading there during major sporting events: be prepared to wait for a table, and be tolerant of the lively (and sometimes rowdy) atmosphere. Trust me, I've been there too - and it's all part of the fun!

I received prompt and professional service on a Saturday, which was impressive. The task was a simple mirror repair, but the team made it a seamless experience for me. I've had the pleasure of using their services in Charlotte before, and they consistently deliver great results.

I recently dined at Union Station in St. Louis and had a positive experience. I opted for the Ponchartrain, which my server informed me was identical to Tilapia, despite both options being listed on the menu - a curious decision. The dish itself was delicious, featuring mushrooms and a rich cream sauce. We also ordered the shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake appetizers, which were decent but not exceptional. The drinks and service were satisfactory. We took advantage of the pleasant weather and dined on the patio, but the interior of the restaurant looked cozy and slightly more formal.

I recently visited this trendy spot for a drink and was blown away by the ambiance. The concept is truly one-of-a-kind in St. Pete, and the attention to detail in the remodel is impressive. You'll feel like you're stepping into a scene from a fantasy novel, complete with subtle background music that allows for easy conversation. The bartenders, Michael and Peggy, were warm and engaging, making the experience even more enjoyable. Although I didn't try the food this time, the prices for their meat and cheese trays seem very reasonable compared to similar establishments in the area. I'm looking forward to returning to try their menu and would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a unique and welcoming atmosphere.

I'm absolutely thrilled with Maple Street Patisserie! This bakery has never failed to impress me. In fact, their blueberry muffin is the best I've ever had the pleasure of trying. Whether you're in the mood for a delicious breakfast or lunch, this spot is a must-visit. Plus, they offer specialty cakes, including king cakes during Mardi Gras season. What really sets them apart, though, is the owner, Ziggy, who works tirelessly to create these mouthwatering treats. His dedication is truly admirable. Overall, I highly recommend Maple Street Patisserie - you won't be disappointed!

I enjoyed the Bourbon Black and Bleu burger, cooked to my liking and very flavorful. However, our large party of 9 had to wait over an hour for our food, which was unacceptable. Despite this, I'd recommend the burger, but they need to improve their service speed.

Whenever we have visitors from out of town, we always take them to Katie's. The food is amazing and there's a lot to choose from. Plus, it's affordable and delicious! You can't go wrong with their grilled oysters, shrimp and grits, Cuban sandwich, pizza, or soup and salad. They also have daily specials that feature local and seasonal ingredients. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Just be aware that Sundays can get busy after church, but you can always grab a drink and enjoy their bottomless Mimosas while you wait!

After attending the Zurich Classic golf tournament, I stopped by Creole Creamery for a refreshing treat. The warm and humid weather made an ice cream cone the perfect choice. I was lucky to find street parking and was impressed by the cozy interior. The massive flavor selection was overwhelming, but after trying a few unique options, I opted for a scoop of cookie monster ice cream on a cone. The ice cream was a hit - not too sweet and totally satisfying. I highly recommend checking out Creole Creamery!

I'm absolutely obsessed with this place! As a regular customer for the past few years, I can confidently say it's a hidden gem. While it may not be the most conventional spot, with a quirky atmosphere that might not appeal to everyone, it truly shines when it comes to its extensive Saki selection, mouth-watering rolls, and generous portions of rice and Sashimi. The vibrant, youthful energy is palpable, with loud dance music setting the tone for a lively night out. If you're a Saki enthusiast like myself, this is the ultimate destination!

We highly recommend this place - every dish we've tried has been a hit! The Backyard Bowl is our top pick so far, but we're excited to try more. The portions are generous, and we're always satisfied with a kids' size or a shared large. The high-quality ingredients make for filling meals at a reasonable price. Be prepared for a wait, especially during peak hours, but trust us, it's worth it.

The service was a bit unusual, as our server was new to the job. However, the food presentation was a highlight - it looked great. One area for improvement was the gumbo, which could have used either a side of rice or a more generous serving of potato salad. On a separate note, the Sprite I ordered was flat, but fortunately, I didn't end up needing it anyway.

This pancake spot is a solid choice, but it can get a bit chaotic when it's slammed with customers. The pancakes themselves are tasty, but be prepared for a sugar rush - they're extremely sweet. On the plus side, the prices are reasonable. One major advantage is that they serve breakfast all day, which is a definite perk. However, there's nothing particularly unique or standout about the menu that you can't find elsewhere.
Discovering hidden gems has never been so exciting! The amazing staff made our shopping experience truly unforgettable. We can't wait to come back and uncover more treasures!

I've been a loyal customer since childhood, and now I'm proud to bring my own kids here. The staff has been like family, watching us grow up over the years. They're not only friendly and personable but also incredibly efficient with their service. Special shoutout to Yoli and Frank - they're the epitome of excellence! The food is simply amazing, with the shredded beef burro and cheese crisp being my absolute favorites. In my opinion, this place serves up genuinely authentic Mexican cuisine.

I would give this restaurant 2 stars for dining in. The service was disappointing and the venue was subpar. The food was average, but if I had gotten takeout, I might have given it 3 stars. I ordered the lamb kebab, which was just okay. It was very plain, with no sauces, lettuce, or other toppings - just the meat.

This Middle Eastern restaurant is a standout in the area, consistently serving exceptional cuisine that never fails to impress. The quality of their dishes is unparalleled, and I always leave feeling satisfied and delighted.

I am astonished that anyone would rate this establishment with only one star. Allow me to share my experience. In my opinion, they offer the superior cannoli in the city. Termini's and Isgro's, while well-known, do not come close to matching the quality of Potito's. As a result, Potito's has become my go-to destination for cannoli, and I wouldn't consider visiting anywhere else. I make it a point to visit every Christmas Eve, and I intend to continue this tradition for years to come. This year, I waited in line for two hours at Isgro's for a tiramisu, whereas I was able to walk into Potito's and promptly purchase my preferred Bambino cannoli stuffed cannoli. I assure you, it is every bit as delightful as it sounds.

I'm absolutely thrilled to rave about this hidden gem of an eatery! As someone who grew up surrounded by authentic Mexican cuisine in the Texas panhandle, I've been on a lifelong quest to find restaurants that live up to my high standards. And let me tell you, El Limon is the crème de la crème of Mexican restaurants in Pennsylvania! Their menu boasts an impressive array of mouthwatering dishes, from sopes and tostadas to enchiladas, fajitas, burritos, and fish tacos - each one expertly prepared and ridiculously affordable. The waitstaff is always warm, welcoming, and attentive, making every visit a true delight. But what truly sets El Limon apart are its two standout features: their heavenly homemade tamales and complimentary margaritas! Whether you're a foodie, a family, or just looking for a fantastic dining experience, El Limon is the perfect destination for an unforgettable Mexican feast. ¡Olé!

I'm awarding this establishment 4 stars, with the potential to reach 5-star excellence once they iron out a few wrinkles. As a frequent visitor to the area, I've had the opportunity to dine here multiple times, and I'm confident that the minor issues I've encountered will be resolved as they continue to refine their operations. The staff is more than willing to make amends when mistakes occur, which is a testament to their commitment to customer satisfaction.

The food, overall, is exceptional. While some reviewers have raved about the pizza, I found it to be somewhat lacking, with a greasy texture and a cheese blend that may not be 100% mozzarella. However, the other dishes I've tried have been outstanding:

* The Quaker (chicken version) is a highlight, with chunky chicken, perfectly melted cheese, and fresh vegetables. A bit more seasoning on the chicken would elevate it to perfection.
* The fries are crispy and flavorful, with no need for ketchup.
* The onion rings are crispy and delicious, with a minimal amount of grease.
* The spanakopita was slightly overcooked, but the flavors were excellent.
* The baklava is a standout, with a perfect balance of sweet and savory.
* The Signature Salad features incredibly fresh vegetables and a tangy balsamic dressing.
* The (turkey) Greek Burger is one of the best I've ever had, with a moist and flavorful patty, topped with a delectable homemade tzatziki sauce. The fresh romaine lettuce and absence of feta were minor deviations from the menu, but the sauce more than made up for it.

Overall, this establishment has tremendous potential and is already serving up high-quality dishes. If they maintain their standards, I'll be a regular customer.

**Planet Fitness: A Great Value with 24/7 Access**

Planet Fitness stands out with its 24-hour operation, earning it a 4-star rating. If you're on a budget, it's the cheapest option that offers the best value for your money. For just $20.00 a month, you'll have access to a range of amenities, including tanning beds, massage chairs, and a sculpt machine.

**Note:** The $9.99 membership option is available, but it comes with some limitations, such as no guest privileges.

Despite the lack of motivation from bodybuilders, the gym is still a great choice. The staff is consistently polite and helpful, making it a welcoming environment for everyone.

Extremely let down. We arrived at 2:15 pm on Saturday to grab a bite, only to be informed that the kitchen had already closed at 2 pm. This was a surprise, given their website explicitly states they're open all day on Saturdays and Sundays until 5 pm. I'm always skeptical of establishments that can't get basic details like their hours correct online. It raises concerns about their attention to quality and other important details.
I'm super impressed with these guys! They're total pros - they get the job done on schedule and stand behind their work with a warranty. If you need something done, I'd definitely give them a shout!

I'm hooked on this place! I make it a point to dine here at least twice a week, and every time I'm blown away by the exceptional service - the servers are always beaming with friendly smiles. The food? Absolutely incredible! I've never left feeling anything less than completely satisfied, with a full stomach and a heart full of joy.

Hidden Gem Alert! We stumbled upon the transformed Carrow's Restaurant on Plumb and Kietzke, and it's a real treasure! This former gem was saved from demolition by its stunning redwood beams and fascia, and now it's serving up culinary masterpieces. The food was nothing short of phenomenal! My wife devoured the tri-tip salad, with its perfectly balanced balsamic vinaigrette, tender medium-rare tri-tip, and crispy potato "croutons" that added a delightful textural twist. I opted for the tri-tip, chicken, and combo, paired with the fresh corn salad and creamy potato salad - every bite was pure bliss! We were so impressed that we indulged in dessert, a rare treat for us. The lemon meringue pie stole the show, with its silky, golden-brown meringue that melted in our mouths. And the best part? The prices were incredibly reasonable for the exceptional quality and ambiance. We've already raved about it to our friends and family, and we can't wait to return for another unforgettable dining experience. Kudos to the chef and team - you've truly outdone yourselves!

I didn't have the pleasure of having Rebecca as my doula during my birth, but I did have the privilege of having her as our nanny for our firstborn daughter. As she spent more time in our home, I looked forward to our conversations before and after work. As an expectant mom pregnant with my second child, I found her insights and suggestions to be incredibly valuable. Rebecca is not only easy to talk to, but also honest and truthful - a quality I truly appreciate. Her passion for her role as a doula shines through, and she has a deep respect for the strength and beauty of the labor process. I highly recommend having Rebecca on your support team - she would be a wonderful addition!

I recently had my car tinted at Orange Tint and Tune and received exceptional service. The shop offers a convenient car pick-up service for customers within a 4-mile radius. My technician, Carlos, took the time to explain all the tint options and even adjusted the grade to achieve the look I wanted. The receptionist was friendly, and the owner, Dustin, followed up to ensure I was satisfied with the service. Overall, I highly recommend Orange Tint and Tune and give them 5 stars for their outstanding customer care.

I stayed at this TownePlace Suites for three nights on business and had a pleasant experience. The hotel's proximity to the airport is convenient, yet surprisingly quiet. The rooms are standard TownePlace Suites fare, equipped with a refrigerator, stove, and other amenities. The surrounding area is quiet, with a mix of hotels and office buildings, and is about a 20-minute drive from downtown or the university area. The Pima Air Museum is just a 5-10 minute drive away. While dining options are limited, there are some fast food choices and a great sandwich shop called Baggins within walking distance. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast offered a standard continental spread with a few hot options. They also host a weekday evening reception, which could be a decent substitute for dinner if you arrive early. My only suggestion for improvement is that they should restock the food and drinks more frequently during the reception, as options ran out quickly. Overall, the rooms are comfortable, the beds are cozy, and the area feels safe.

Detour Delight: Discovering a Hidden Gem in Tampa!

A unexpected diversion to Tampa turned into a culinary adventure when we stumbled upon a local treasure, thanks to Yelp's expert guidance. We dodged the chain restaurants and opted for an authentic experience, and boy, are we glad we did!

The ladies indulged in the tender 7 oz. Tampa strip, while the gentlemen devoured the massive 14 oz. ribeye. The real magic happened when we discovered they grill their steaks over oak and citrus wood, infusing them with a smoky flavor that's simply sublime! As fellow wood-smoke enthusiasts, we were thrilled to find a kindred spirit in this kitchen. It's a rare find, indeed, and well worth the detour!

Sides of fresh veggies and sweet potatoes complemented our meals perfectly. And the wine list? A refreshing surprise! Most bottles were under $20, with a thoughtful selection that didn't break the bank. No outrageous markups here!

Our wonderful waitress, Lisa, offered spot-on recommendations and treated us to warm, friendly service that made us feel right at home. We're so grateful we took a chance on this local gem instead of settling for a chain. This hidden gem is now firmly bookmarked for our next Tampa visit. Don't miss out on this incredible find!

After my initial review, the owner of this location (who also owns two other locations, including one in Southampton) personally reached out to me. We had a lengthy conversation that lasted about 30 minutes, and I was thoroughly impressed by his business approach. He's exactly the kind of person I'd want to do business with. I decided to give Saladworks another chance, visiting twice more, and was pleased to find that the service had significantly improved. The new summer salads are a particular highlight - they're absolutely delicious!

This deli is the best I've encountered in the entire US, offering a wide variety of unique options that make it difficult to decide. The Muffalata sandwich is enormous, easily shareable among four people, and is incredibly flavorful and delicious. I recommend visiting on Saturday or Thursday evenings when they feature live music. The daily special is always a good choice, and there are plenty of sides to select from, including excellent chili, potato salad, and chips. Don't hesitate - go now and experience it for yourself!

As my dad and I embarked on our epic cross-country adventure, our inaugural stop was the breathtaking Saguaro National Park. We were fortunate to join a guided tour led by the incomparable Park Ranger Carolyn, whose infectious enthusiasm and vast knowledge of the iconic saguaro cacti left us in awe. Her passion for her work was palpable, making the experience truly unforgettable. If you're planning a visit, I highly recommend joining one of Carolyn's tours - you won't be disappointed!

So I checked out this spot after my hubby brought home their insane lemon pepper wings. They've got a ton of flavors to choose from - you know, the usual suspects like lemon pepper and mild, but also some more unique ones like yaka mein and noonie bird, which are inspired by New Orleans. And don't even get me started on their drinks! The watermelon flavor is literally amazing... I have no idea what kind of magic they're using, but it's a game-changer. The location could be better, but you can tell they're really trying to give back to the community. It's near the daiquiri shop, so it's not so bad during the day. I might not venture out there alone at night, though. Anyway, def give this place a shot - and you might even run into Skip!

Hey there! I'm back at Tom Jones and I've got an update for you! I noticed that weird ATM machine that only lets you take out cash to pay for your meal is gone - it used to be near the restrooms. But don't worry, there's still a payphone back there, and I'm obsessed with it! Now, there are ATMs at the front entrance, so that's convenient.

The blue ribbon deal is still a steal at $3.79 - you get pancakes, 2 eggs, toast, sausage, bacon, juice, and coffee! My kids and I went there recently, and my daughter just loves Tom Jones. We ordered a bunch of stuff, including blue ribbons, French toast, chicken, a club sandwich, and a baked potato. Everyone got exactly what they wanted.

I didn't notice any stale smoke smell, and the place didn't feel dirty to me. I actually love the bright orange booths - they're so retro! And the payphone is just the cherry on top. The service is always super fast, and I always get a different waitress. I don't know where they find these awesome young ladies, but they're doing something right! The managers are all on top of things too, which is great to see.

Since Tom Jones is my daughter's fave spot, I'm bumping up my rating from 4 to 5 stars. It's definitely a winner in my book!

As an amateur athlete, I've had the privilege of meeting Dr. Ferrel under circumstances I'd rather forget. During a softball game, I suffered a severe injury that left me sidelined. Dr. Ferrel, who was in attendance, rushed to my aid and expertly relocated my ankle on the field. He then invited me to visit his office for further treatment. However, as a single mother living on a teacher's salary, I was hesitant due to financial constraints. Instead, I sought care from a physician, who delivered a disheartening prognosis: months of recovery before I could return to the game. Feeling defeated and hopeless, I reached out to Dr. Ferrel once more. True to his word, he took me under his care and worked wonders. Not only did he treat my injury, but he also facilitated a remarkable recovery, getting me back on the field in mere weeks. Over the years, I've had the pleasure of returning to Dr. Ferrel for various treatments, each time experiencing astonishing results. To me, he will always be a hero, a testament to the power of exceptional medical care and compassion.

Get ready for an unforgettable experience! Their shows are always a blast, offering a uniquely entertaining and relaxed atmosphere that will leave you feeling carefree and energized. Plus, enjoy delicious food at a fair price, making it the perfect spot for a fantastic night out with friends or family!

Craving satisfaction guaranteed! There are those moments when only In-N-Out will do. You know, when nothing else can hit the spot like a juicy, indulgent burger. I'm talking 4 patties, Animal Style, because why settle for less? It's time to treat yourself to the ultimate In-N-Out experience!

Cindy's establishment is truly exceptional. The culinary experience is enhanced by the outstanding service. The authenticity of the cuisine is matched only by the genuine hospitality of the staff. Notably, all dishes are prepared fresh, and the distinction from other Mexican restaurants is palpable from the first bite. I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone who appreciates authentic Mexican cuisine.

I have been eager to try Trust Me BBQ for over a year, but my initial visit approximately three months ago was disappointing. Despite waiting in line for 10 minutes, I received no service and ultimately left. After reviewing online feedback, I decided to give the establishment another opportunity to showcase its offerings. Unfortunately, my experience was mixed, with the food being average and the service being subpar. As a result, I am unlikely to return.

The gentleman attending to us at the counter failed to engage with us in any way, neglecting to speak, smile, or acknowledge our presence. The transaction felt impersonal, akin to interacting with a vending machine. Furthermore, when we placed our order, he failed to listen attentively, resulting in incorrect sides being included in our meals. We were forced to correct him while he was serving us.

In conclusion, I will likely continue to patronize Down to the Bone BBQ instead. The positives of my experience at Trust Me BBQ included the delicious BBQ sauce, the unique and intriguing macaroni salad, and the moist "pulled" pork. However, the negatives outweighed the positives. The chicken was excessively dry and inedible, even when paired with the BBQ sauce. The macaroni and cheese appeared to have been sitting on the steam table for several days, and the collard greens lacked robust flavor.

I stumbled upon this hidden gem during my week-long visit to the area and I'm so glad I did! The panang chicken was absolutely delicious. I opted for a one-star spicy level and it arrived promptly. I'll definitely be back for more!

Get ready to fiesta! Cinco de Mayo is all about delicious margaritas, refreshing sangria, and crispy fried treats - and this amazing spot has got it all down pat! They're masters at blending flavors from different cultures to create one-of-a-kind recipes that will tantalize your taste buds. Even though they're not a traditional Mexican joint, they know how to bring the heat with their rock salt and tequila game. And the best part? They just opened a wine bar right next door, perfect for when you need a little extra space or want to try something special. Give it up for their on-the-rocks margaritas and homemade white or red sangria - trust us, it's totally worth the trip!

Discover the Sweet Gem of Hermitage: A Donut Bakery Like No Other!

Tucked away in one of Hermitage's oldest shopping centers lies a hidden treasure - a small, family-owned donut bakery that's a must-visit for anyone with a sweet tooth. Owner Yeu's dedication to his craft is evident in the early morning hours he spends perfecting his recipes to bring you the freshest donuts daily.

But this bakery is no ordinary donut shop. Yeu's creativity shines through in his unique offerings, including donuts topped with crispy bacon, sweet apple fritters, pigs in a blanket, flaky breakfast pastries, and savory kolaches. And then, there's the pièce de résistance - the doughssant, a revolutionary fusion of a donut and a croissant that will leave you wanting more!

The best part? These indulgent treats won't break the bank. Doughssants are only $1.99 each, while regular donuts are a steal at just $0.60 each. As a parent, I can attest that these sweet treats make the perfect gift for my kids' teachers, who absolutely adore them.

And to complete the experience, pair your donut with a freshly brewed cup of coffee. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this charming bakery is a must-visit destination that's sure to satisfy your cravings and leave you feeling like you've stumbled upon a sweet secret.

We've had an absolute blast at every event we've attended! From the energy-packed concerts to the thrilling basketball games, each experience has been an unforgettable adventure. And to top it off, the food has been exceptional, featuring a wide range of local favorites that are sure to satisfy any appetite.

Fantastic dining experience! We sampled a variety of dishes, including three appetizers and five entrees, and every single one impressed us. The prices are very affordable, and the service is top-notch. I'd highly recommend this restaurant and would definitely return for more.
The service at this place has gotten worse. We used to come here often, but now we go somewhere else. The service was too slow and they would often forget about us.

I was disappointed with my recent chicken and rice plate from this establishment. When I placed my order, I specifically requested no sauce on the chicken to make it a healthier option. However, when I opened my to-go container, I was surprised to find an excessive amount of oil - approximately 5-7 tablespoons - which was not what I had been told. Unfortunately, this made the dish unappetizing and unhealthy. I was also surprised given the restaurant's slogan, which emphasizes healthy options. I hope they will take my feedback into consideration to improve their dishes and align with their brand promise.

I'm absolutely thrilled with my recent purchase of a washer and dryer from Sears! As a new homeowner, I needed to furnish my entire place with new appliances, and I'm so glad I chose Sears despite some mixed reviews. My experience was completely seamless - the selection was amazing, the sales team was super knowledgeable, and the delivery was lightning-fast. The level of service I received was truly exceptional! The team went above and beyond to find me the best deals and stayed within my budget. They even took the time to scour for additional discounts and sales prices. I appreciated their honest advice and prompt answers to all my questions. I'm thoroughly impressed with Sears and would highly recommend them to anyone!

I'm obsessed with the food here! The service is super speedy, and the staff is genuinely lovely. Every time I walk in to place an order, I feel like I'm among friends - they always make me feel so welcome!

As a skeptic, I walked into the remodeled establishment with low expectations. But, I was pleasantly surprised. The revamped atmosphere was impressive, and the real test - the food - did not disappoint. The mushroom cheese steak, in particular, stole the show.

I'm obsessed with the espresso here - it's seriously top-notch! This is my go-to spot for a perfect Americano. The staff is super friendly and polite, and the atmosphere is always chill and relaxed. Just a heads up, though: there aren't any power outlets, so come charged up! On the bright side, the wifi is unlimited and always reliable. And, I've gotta say, the bathrooms and the whole place are always spotless.

I fell hook, line, and sinker for the rave reviews, but my experience was a crushing disappointment from start to finish. The website, which I thought would give me a sneak peek into their menu, was a letdown. I had to navigate through three locations and scroll to the bottom to find a list of options with zero descriptions or prices. It was like they wanted to keep their menu a secret! 

When I arrived, I was surprised to find a bar-like atmosphere with tables scattered around. No big deal, but I was excited to try their sandwiches, which were reasonably priced at $6.85. I opted for the roast beef and roast pork combos, hoping for the best. 

The sandwiches arrived quickly, but that's where the excitement ended. The roast beef was ice-cold, while the roast pork was piping hot. I mean, how does that even happen? It was clear that one of them had been sitting around for a while. I asked my waitress to reheat the roast beef, and although it was warmer when it came back, it was still lukewarm compared to the roast pork I had just devoured. 

The real kicker was the lack of meat in both sandwiches. It was like they were trying to make up for it by drowning them in gravy, making them a messy, structural nightmare. The menu did mention a "wet meat" option, which I now realize is a must-have. If you're planning to visit, trust me and opt for that style – your taste buds and sandwich will thank you.

Village Whiskey's takeout treasure: a indulgent delight for the senses! The Whiskey Burger, a luxurious treat at $26, is a must-try for those who dare to get a little messy. This juicy behemoth is packed with tender goodness, crispy bacon, and a generous helping of flavor. If you can stomach the steep price tag, get ready for a burger that will leave you weak in the knees. And don't even get me started on the Duck Fat fries - rich, decadent, and utterly irresistible. Treat yourself, but don't say I didn't warn you...

I recently invested $80 in a family meal and found it to be a worthwhile expenditure. The food was served hot and the orange chicken was exceptionally flavorful, surpassing my expectations. As a result, this establishment has earned its place as our go-to destination for Asian cuisine.

I usually do my laundry at my boyfriend's house, but with recent family visitors, I had a mountain of towels, sheets, and comforters to tackle. I needed a reliable laundry mat that was safe, clean, and free of unsavory characters. That's when I stumbled upon this gem of a facility. I was thrilled to find it spotless, well-lit, and staffed by friendly and helpful attendants. The laundry and drying process was incredibly fast - I managed to complete four oversized loads (equivalent to eight regular loads) in under two hours! The amenities were impressive, too: security cameras, flat-screen TVs, magazines, Wi-Fi, clean restrooms, and vending machines. The atmosphere was pleasant and relaxed, with plenty of available washers and dryers. I'm so grateful to have discovered this laundry mat - thank you for providing such a wonderful experience!

We popped in for a spontaneous dinner last evening. The prices were undoubtedly steep. Both pairs of us opted to share a dish, which visibly irked our server, and while the cuisine was satisfying, it didn't quite justify the cost. One notable exception was the incredible garlic bread they served as an appetizer - I could have easily devoured an entire loaf! Overall, I'm unlikely to return to this establishment, but it's possible we caught them on an off night. With so many exceptional dining options in the St. Louis area, the competition is simply too fierce.

I scored a touchdown with my lunch plans today, catching a Seahawks/Saints game at this hotspot and indulging in the mouth-watering Haven burger. No surprise the place was buzzing with energy - the flavors were a real winner! I snagged a seat by the door, but soon found myself navigating a sea of fans to get out - clearly, I wasn't the only one in on the secret. I'll be back for another round, maybe on a quieter Tuesday lunch to avoid the frenzy. The Haven has earned a spot on my playbook!

I've only tried the vermicelli bowls, not the Pho. The portions are decent and reasonably priced. As a bonus, the location is convenient for Alberta Ave residents, and my orders are always ready in 15 minutes, even on busy Friday nights.

I recently dined at this restaurant, and unfortunately, the food was a letdown. I opted for the Chicken Marsala, which our waiter recommended, but it was a disappointment. The chicken was thin, tough, and dry, and the accompanying pasta was undercooked and clumpy. To make matters worse, the dish lacked any discernible flavor.

My friend's lasagna was also a miss, with a meager layer of pasta and no flavor to speak of. To add insult to injury, when my other friend got up to use the restroom, the staff cleared her plate, despite her telling the waiter she wasn't finished. Although they did bring her a new meal in a to-go bag, it was a frustrating experience.

On the bright side, the atmosphere was great, and the live music was a nice touch. I did enjoy dancing with my husband. However, considering the subpar food, the high prices were hard to swallow.

This hidden gem boasts an attractive space and a prime location near the Broad Street line, with ample street parking available. As a BYOB establishment, you can bring your favorite drinks to enjoy with their delicious dishes. I've had the pleasure of dining here twice, and every dish has impressed me. Standouts include the flavorful chaats, tender beef short ribs, spicy lamb vindaloo, refreshing beet salad, and savory breads and pickles. The rich chocolate cake is a must-share for the table. Plus, you can grab takeout beer from the corner bar. We can't wait to return and try more!

I highly recommend this restaurant! The ceviche is a must-try, it's absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is lively and enjoyable, and the service is top-notch. Our server, Alex, provided exceptional service - he was friendly, attentive, and thoughtful, making our dining experience truly memorable.
I love this store! The salad bar is always fresh, and they offer a wide variety of ethnic foods to try. Highly recommended!

I recently ordered a delicious Mediterranean chicken shawarma that exceeded my expectations. The generous serving of juicy chicken packed into a flavorful pita was a pleasant surprise. The convenience of having my food ready for pickup upon arrival was a bonus. The excellent service only added to the positive experience, ensuring that I'll definitely be back for more when I'm in the area again.

I'm absolutely obsessed with this hidden gem! The cuisine is mouth-watering, the ambiance is warm and inviting, and the staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. Whether you're a veggie enthusiast or a meat lover, this spot is a must-visit destination that's sure to delight!

After a brief wait, we finally received excellent service. The gumbo was outstanding, and the chicken and waffles were a highlight. The friendly staff and prime location on Bourbon Street made for great people-watching.

I'm so glad I stumbled upon Earl's at the airport! This grab-and-go spot really delivers with its variety of delicious sandwiches - from classic turkey and tuna to a tasty Hawaiian option. But today, the aroma of roast beef won me over, and I'm so glad it did! The generous portion of tender, perfectly cooked beef paired with melted cheddar cheese and a zesty horseradish sauce was absolute perfection. And the best part? No need for lettuce or tomatoes - it's just right the way it is! Plus, its convenient location between the security station and the D gates (just a stone's throw from the Delta SkyClub!) makes it easy to grab and enjoy at the gate or on the plane. Yum!

I'm blown away by this place! The food is top-notch and the service is even better. We kicked things off with an amazing appetizer of cheese curds served with a sweet and spicy red pepper jelly - it was love at first bite! For dinner, I went with the fish tacos and my wife opted for a beer brat. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals, and the portions were huge and reasonably priced. Our server was fantastic, super attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. They made us feel right at home. The manager even stopped by to check in and I let him know that I've found my new go-to spot to catch a game and grab a beer. He filled us in on their game-day deals and weekend brunch specials. As we left, everyone bid us farewell and reminded us to grab a root beer candy on our way out. I'll definitely be back!

I stumbled upon a hidden gem for dinner and drinks, and I'm still beaming with delight! As a self-proclaimed burger connoisseur, I usually shy away from ordering them at restaurants since I can whip up a mean patty at home. But, oh boy, this place has ruined me for life! The burger was so phenomenal that I'll be hard-pressed to resist ordering it again on my next visit. The cherry on top? A solid beer selection and a warm, welcoming team of wait staff and bartenders who made me feel like a regular. My meal was cooked to perfection, arrived promptly, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. And, let's not forget the sparkling clean restrooms - a true testament to their attention to detail! All in all, I left feeling thoroughly impressed and already counting down the days until my return.
